text: :For the crab genus, see Kraussia (crab). Kraussia is a flowering plant genus in the family Rubiaceae. Apart from a species in Socotra, they are native to continental Africa. The type was described from a plant collected by Dr. F. Krauss near Durban. It is differentiated from Tricalysia and Empogona by the ovule arrangement inside the ovary cells. The genus contains between 4 and 10 species, including: * Kraussia floribunda Harv. (1842) * Kraussia kirkii (Hook.f.) Bullock * Kraussia socotrana Bridson * Kraussia speciosa Bullock == References == Category:Rubiaceae genera Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Kraussia
